intro: Psychotria cuneifolia, commonly known as the "Coneleaf Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but have a mild, bitter taste. Psychotria cuneifolia is often found in shaded, humid environments and is part of the diverse flora in its native ecosystems.
